mainText: We want to wish a very happy retirement to Director of Operations Wendy Spencer. Wendy has devoted 20 years to Turning Point Scotland and the social care sector. On behalf of all staff and people we support, 'Don't be sad it is over, we are all just very grateful it happened.'

titleText: Ramping up - Housing First Scotland Annual Conference 2019
mainText: Our very own Patrick McKay will be speaking at the Housing First Annual conference on 22nd May. Held at the Edinburgh International Conference Centre, this 'Ramping Up' event will look at the Housing First approach and what this means for homelessness in Scotland. Patrick will be discussing the seven principles that underpin Housing First and contribute to its success. The session will be a mastercalss for those already delivering Housing First, or those new to it. Join us and a host of other speakers at the Housing First Annual Conference, 2019.

Congratulations to staff and people being supported by our Dumfries and Galloway service for raising money to buy a Dermlite machine for Castle Douglas Health Centre. This machine will allow G.P's to diagnose melanoma and other skin cancers at a surgery appointment. Having this service locally means that people won't have to travel into Dumfries for initial diagnosis, reducing the distance and logistics of travelling.
